member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.ReturnObject
member.summary: Finalizes an OptionObject so it can be returned to AvatarNX.

remarks.para:
About this class
Before returning an OptionObject to AvatarNX, it must be finalized. That's what this class does. It finalizes the
OptionObject so it can be returned to AvatarNX.

Also...
Please see the Tingen documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.ReturnObject.Finalize(Outpost31.Core.Session.TingenSession,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Finalize an to be returned to AvatarNX.

remarks.para:
About this method
The finalization process is a two part process:
Assign an error code to the returnOptionObject
Verify the returnOptionObject cointains all required data
And here is the list of valid error codes:
Error code Description
0 Success - Returns the OptionObject without a message
1 Error - Stops the script from processing and displays an message with an "OK" button
2 OKCancel - Displays a message with "OK" and "Cancel" buttons.
3 Info - Displays an informational warning message with an "OK" button.
4 YesNo - Displays a message with "Yes" and "No" buttons.
5 OpenURL - Opens an URL in a browser
6 OpenForm - Presents an OK/Cancel dialog to open a form (only be used on Form Load and Field events).
remarks.example:
To return a formatted returnOptionObject:
Core.Avatar.FormatReturnObject.AsErrorCode(tnSession, errorCode, errorMessage);

remarks.para: - Primeval logs are written to C:\TingenData\Primeval\, defined here so it can be easily changed if needed.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.PrimevalLog.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)

remarks.para:
- Before a Primeval log is written, the Primeval log path is verified to ensure it exists.
- Log files may be created quickly - and possibly at the same time - so a pause is added to ensure logs are unique.
- Not currently used.

Trace logs are used to record information about the application's execution.
Records information about Tingen's execution
Used when debugging/troublshooting during development, and should probably be disabled in production
Important details are in the filename: %assemblyName%-%calledClass%-%calledMethod%-%lineNumber.trace
Do not contain any data
To ensure all logs are captured, filenames start with a timestamp: ssfffffff_
Extension is .trace
- More information about Trace logs here.

Primeval logs are vary simple logs that can be created with very little information.
Do not require any paramaters
Used when debugging/troublshooting during development, and should be disabled in production
Important details can be found in the file contents
May have custom messages (the default message is "Tingen primeval log"
To ensure all logs are captured, filenames are timestamped yyMMddHHmmssfffffff
Extenstion is .primeval
- More information about Primeval logs here.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.ParseScriptParameter.Parse(Outpost31.Core.Session.TingenSession)
member.summary: OLD Determines which Tingen Module will be doing the work this session.

remarks.para:
About this class
This class initializes the Tingen configuration settings, which:
Are specific to Tingen core functionality (other components/modules have their own configuration files)
Do not change between Tingen sessions
Can be modified by the user to suit their environment
Are stored in "TingenData\%SystemCode%\Config\Tingen.config"

Also...
Please see the Tingen documentation for more information.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.ConfigSettings.TingenMode
member.summary: Determines the Tingen Mode for the session.

remarks.para:
About this property
- When enabled, the Tingen web service will do work and (potentially) return a modified OptionObject.
- When disabled,the Tingen web service will not do work and will return an unmodified OptionObject.
- These are the valid Tingen modes:
Mode Description
Enabled The Tingen web service is enabled (default).
Disabled The Tingen web service is disabled

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.ConfigSettings.ModOpenIncidentMode
member.summary: Determines if the Open Incident Module functionality is enabled.

remarks.para:
About this property
- When enabled, the Open Incident Module will do work and (potentially) return a modified OptionObject.
- When disabled,the Open Incident Module will not do work and will return an unmodified OptionObject.
- These are the valid Open Incident Module modes:
Mode Description
Enabled The Open Incident Module is enabled (default).
Disabled The Open Incident Module is disabled

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.ConfigSettings.NtstWebServices
member.summary: Determines if the Netmart web services functionality is enabled.

remarks.para:
About this property
This functionality is not currently implemented.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Configuration.ConfigSettings.Load(System.String,System.String)
member.param: Path to the Tingen configuration file.

remarks.para:
About this method
- The configuration file path is created when the session is initialzied.
- If the configuration file does not exist, a configuration file with default values will be created.
- Define the assembly name here so it can be used to write log files throughout the class.
Properties for the Tingen session are located in TingenSession.Properties.cs.
See Outpost31.Core.Configuration.TingenFramework.cs for more information.
See Outpost31.Core.Configuration.TingenFramework.cs for more information.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Session.TingenSession.Build(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The path to the Tingen configuration file.

remarks.para:
The Tingen Session contains all of the information that Tingen needs to do what it does, including:
Configuration settings (user-definable settings from the )
Static settings (these do not change between sessions)
Runtime settings (unique to the current session)
Data sent from Avatar, including the and
Data derived from the or .
Required Tingen Module details.

More information about this method:
This method is one of the most important in Tingen, as it builds the Tingen Session object.
The Session object is built in this order:
A basic TingenSession object is initalized with the current date, time, configuration settings, and Avatar data.
Framework information is added seperately.
Trace log information is added seperately.
Module objects are added seperately.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Module.Common.Action.Field.SaveValue(System.String,System.String,Outpost31.Core.Logger.TraceLog)
member.summary: Saves the value of a field to a file.

remarks.para:
To ensure that any sensitive data is removed at the end of a session, the filePath should adhere to the following standards:
The filename should always start with the currentAvatarUser
The filePath should be in tnSession.TnFramework.TemporaryPath
Since the filePath is user-definable, we will verify that the filePath doesn't exist before (re)creating it.
- Define the assembly name here so it can be used to write log files throughout the class.
- Define the assembly name here so it can be used to write log files throughout the class.
